title: NASA Astronaut Tracy C. Dyson, Crewmates Return from Space Station
summary: NASA astronaut Tracy C. Dyson completed a six-month research mission aboard the International Space Station on Monday, returning to Earth with Roscosmos cosmonauts Oleg Kononenko and Nikolai Chub. The trio departed the space station aboard the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft at 4:36 a.m. EDT Monday, Sept. 23, making a safe, parachute-assisted landing at 7:59 a.m. (4:59 p.m. […]

title: Hera planetary defence mission: solving asteroid mysteries
summary: There’s a mystery out there in deep space – and solving it will make Earth safer. That’s why the European Space Agency’s Hera mission is taking shape – to go where one particular spacecraft has gone before.

title: A Chinese rocket narrowly missed a landing on Sunday—the video is amazing
summary: Deep Blue Aerospace is just one of several Chinese companies working on vertical landing.

title: What every entrepreneur can (and should) learn from early space exploration
summary: In the race to create the next big thing, today’s entrepreneurs are missing one critical ingredient: a daring spirit. It’s this spirit that first propelled humanity into space but which […]

title: Deep Blue Aerospace hop test suffers anomaly moments before landing
summary: HELSINKI — Chinese commercial rocket firm Deep Blue Aerospace conducted a first-stage rocket hop test Sunday, experiencing a partial failure during the final moments of landing. Deep Blue Aerospace carried […]

title: Office of Space Commerce ready to turn on initial version of space traffic coordination system
summary: The Office of Space Commerce is set to turn on the initial version of its civil space traffic coordination system at the end of the month, beginning a transition from the Defense Department that will run through next year.

title: Sentinel-1B journeys back to Earth
summary: The Sentinel-1B satellite, the second satellite of the Copernicus Sentinel-1 mission, completed its disposal process – which included lowering its orbit and passivating its systems to ensure re-entry into Earth’s atmosphere within 25 years.

title: Isar Confirms Hot Fire Testing Has Commenced at Andøya
summary: German rocket builder Isar Aerospace has told European Spaceflight that the company is “currently performing hot fire tests of the first and second stages” that will be used for the inaugural flight of its Spectrum rocket. Isar Aerospace was founded in 2018 and is developing a two-stage rocket called Spectrum. Once operational, the rocket will […]

title: U.S. Space Command’s commercial operations group gets expanded role
summary: The Joint Task Force-Space Defense Commercial Operations cell is broadening its focus beyond space tracking to battlefield intelligence
